landing-page.welcome-desc: TimeScale Creator is an advanced online cloud service designed to help you explore and visualize the geologic time scale with ease. With access to a vast internal database of over 20,000 global and regional events—including biologic, geomagnetic, sea-level, and stable isotope data—TimeScale Creator is the ultimate tool for researchers, educators, and enthusiasts of Earth history.

customize-chart-appearance.title: Customize Chart Appearance
customize-chart-appearance.description: Personalize your chart by adjusting the appearance, colors, and fonts to suit your preferences.

save-custom-settings.title: Save Custom Settings
save-custom-settings.description: Save your custom chart settings for future use and easy access to your preferred configurations.

share-your-charts.title: Share Your Charts
share-your-charts.description: Easily share your custom charts with others via a simple link or by downloading the chart as an image.

toggle-columns.title: Toggle Columns Directly on the Map
toggle-columns.description: Select specific areas to focus on by enabling or disabling chart columns directly on the map.

age-slider.title: Dynamic Age Slider
age-slider.description: Explore how rock formations and geologic events change over time with a simple slider.

link-charts.title: Link Charts to Locations
link-charts.description: Map points connect chart columns to real-world locations for intuitive visualization.

find-columns.title: Find Columns/Events Quickly
find-columns.description: Search for specific columns or events within the chart to quickly locate and focus on relevant information.

age-range.title: Extend/Center Age Range
age-range.description: Extend or center the age range to focus on the details and gurantee the inclusion of the desired information in the chart.

notes.title: View Specific Notes
notes.description: Access detailed notes and information about specific events directly from the chart.

custom.title: Create Custom Datapacks
custom.description: Upload your own data to create custom datapacks and generate charts based on your unique research and findings.

showcase.title: Showcase Your Research
showcase.description: Publish your custom datapacks to share your research, findings, and insights with the global scientific community.

collaborate.title: Collaborate with Others
collaborate.description: View other users' datapacks and collaborate to expand your knowledge and expertise.

datapack.title: What Are Datapacks?
datapack.description: Datapacks are collections of data that can be used to generate charts. TimeScale Creator provides a variety of official datapacks that contain information on global and regional geologic events.

charts.title: What Are Charts?
charts.description: Charts are visual representations of geologic time scales that display the relationships between different geologic events. Users can customize and generate charts based on their unique research and findings.

help.title: Need Help?
help.description: Attend one of our workshops to learn more about TimeScale Creator and how to use its features. Our workshops cover a variety of topics, including chart customization, datapack creation, and more.

select-datapack.title: Select any Datapack
select-datapack.description: Choose from a variety of official datapacks that contain information on global and regional geologic events.

select-age-range.title: Select An Age Range
select-age-range.description: Select the desired age range for your chart to focus on specific geologic events and formations.

select-columns.title: Select/Edit Columns
select-columns.description: Choose the columns you want to display on your chart and customize their appearance, colors

generate.title: Generate Your Chart
generate.description: Generate your chart based on the selected datapack and customized settings.

translation.about: TimeScale Creator Online enables you to explore and create charts of any portion of the geologic time scale from an extensive suite of global and regional events in Earth History. The internal database suite encompasses over 20,000 biologic, geomagnetic, sea-level, stable isotope, and other events.

login.signup: Don't have an account? Sign Up
login.reset-password: Enter your email to receive a password reset link.

signup.title: Sign Up
signup.signin: Already have an account? Sign in
signup.email-sent: Email sent. Please check your email to verify your account.

workshops.login-first: You are not logged in. Please sign in to view your workshops.
workshops.description-header: Click a workshop to see more information!

messages.upcoming: No upcoming workshops at the moment.
messages.active: No active workshops at the moment.
messages.past: No past workshops at the moment.

time.disabled-unit-reason: You cannot change the age unit since it must be on the x-axis.

sidebar.no-markers: No Markers Available (Please Add a Marker by Clicking the Chart in the Main View)
sidebar.no-models: No Models Available (Please Add a Model by Clicking the Chart in the Main View)

out-of-date.title: Chart Out of Date
out-of-date.description: When you're ready, click the button below to apply your changes.

not-created.title: Crossplot Chart Not Created
not-created.description: Please configure your desired crossplot settings and click the button below to generate a crossplot chart.

interval.helper-text: Base age should be older than top age

checkboxs.skip-empty-columns: Gray out (and do not draw) columns which do not have data on the selected time interval

checkboxs.stage-background: Enabled stage background for event columns

load-dialog.message: This will overwrite any changes you've made!

tooltip.not-in-range: Data not included in time range

overlay-menu.title: Overlay Settings
overlay-menu.overlay-accordion-caption: *Grayed out columns are disabled for Overlay (not Event or Point column)
overlay-menu.invalid-column-mouseover: Not an Event or Point Column

add-custom-column-menu.data-mining-description: Calculates statistical metrics (such as minimum, maximum, average, and rate of change) for a given point column over sliding windows of data.
add-custom-column-menu.dual-column-comparison-description: Overlays multiple columns of data to visually compare their trends, patterns, or values side-by-side.
add-custom-column-menu.select-base-column: Please Select a Point or Event Column

font.notes1: These are the default systemwide fonts.
font.notes2: Changing one here will affect the entire chart.
font.notes3: NOTE: These fonts can be changed on a column by column basis by using the Font button for each column

map-points.not-avaliable: No Map Points available for this datapack

datapacks.see-info-guidance: Click a datapack to see more information!
datapacks.add-datapack-guidance: Add a datapack by clicking the checkbox

upload-form.title: Upload Your Own Datapack
upload-form.name: Datapack Name
upload-form.name-placeholder: Enter a name for your datapack.
upload-form.author: Authored By
upload-form.priority-tooltip: Lowest priority datapacks will appear first
upload-form.description-placeholder: Enter a description for your datapack.
upload-form.contact-helper-text: (OPTIONAL) If you would like others to contact you about this datapack
upload-form.notes-placeholder: Enter notes for the datapack here
upload-form.notes-helper-text: (OPTIONAL) Generally notes are settings recommendations/How to use your datapack most efficiently

confirm-datapack-change.message: You have unsaved changes! Do you want to save your changes?

confirm-changes.message: Are you sure you want to discard your changes?

qsg.title: Quick Start Quide
qsg.content: Welcome to Time Scale Creator Online! In this Quick Start Guide, you will quickly learn about the functions of each tab on the Nav bar. Click the 'Start QSG' button to begin.

content.datapacks: In the datapacks tour you will explore the Datapacks page in depth. Click the button to start your tour!
content.settings: In the settings tour you will explore the Settings page in depth. Click the button to start your tour!

report-bug.title: Report a Bug
report-bug.subtitle: Thank you for helping us improve our product! Please provide the details below to help us better understand the issue and resolve it as quickly as possible.
report-bug.name: Name/ID
report-bug.email-helper-text: This field is optional, but if you provide your email, we can contact you for more information or to notify you when the issue is resolved.
report-bug.description: Please briefly describe the bug or issue you encountered.
report-bug.thank-you: Thank you for your feedback! We appreciate your help
report-bug.redirect: You will be redirected to the homepage in
report-bug.loading-subheader: Please wait while we process your report.

qsg.step1: In the Presets page, we offer pre-configured settings that allow you to rapidly generate specific types of charts without configuring all options from the beginning. Each preset comes equipped with designated data packs, visual styles, and settings, enabling you to create charts with just a single click.
qsg.step2: In the Datapacks page, you can select the datapacks required to generate your charts. We offer nine official data packs, each containing a curated collection of datasets tailored for specific thematic explorations. For more detailed guidance on Datapacks, please refer to the Datapacks Tour under the "Tours" section
qsg.step3: In the Chart page, you can view the charts you have created and explore the detailed visualizations of geologic events. Additionally, you have the option to download and save these charts for your reference or further analysis.
qsg.step4: In the Settings page, you can customize all aspects of your charts. This includes adjusting the scale and time range, selecting which rows to display, setting the background color and font style, etc. Tailor your charts to meet your specific needs and preferences to optimize your visual analysis. For more detailed guidance on Settings, please refer to the Settings Tour under the "Tours" section
qsg.step5: In the Help Page, you can find detailed assistance and information on how to use the website.
qsg.step6: In the Workshops Page, you can access a range of educational and experimental tutorials that offer in-depth guidance. Here, you can explore the workshops you have registered for, allowing you to engage with the content and enhance your skills in a hands-on learning environment.
qsg.step7: The About Page provides information about our development team.
qsg.step8: Click here to sign in and unlock the features mentioned earlier, such as accessing registered workshops. Once logged in, you will also have the ability to upload datapacks and take full advantage of all functionalities.

datapack.step1: Switch between different display types for datapacks: rows, cards, or compact view.
datapack.step2: Add a datapack by clicking the checkbox
datapack.step3: Click the deselect icon to deselect all datapacks

settings.step1: In the Time settings, you can Set the "Top of Interval" and "Base of Interval" for your data. These fields allow you to define the starting and ending ages or stages, which can be adjusted by entering values or using the dropdown selectors. Adjust the vertical scale to change how much vertical space each million years occupies on your charts. For example, setting it higher will spread the intervals further apart, making each period easier to examine closely.
settings.step2: In the Preferences settings, you can customize the display options. For instance, you may choose to gray out columns with no data for selected time periods, add tooltips for additional information, or enable filtering and legend options for charts. Furthermore, you can load your settings from a file or save your current settings to a file. This feature is useful for backing up your configurations, sharing them with others, or quickly applying previously saved configurations to your chart.
settings.step3: In Column Settings, you can deeply customize the appearance and organization of your charts.In the "Column Customization" area, you can adjust titles and shift row positions to streamline how data is displayed on your charts. Enable or disable specific elements like the chart title and Ma markers to suit your presentation needs. In the "Font Options" section, refine the appearance of your charts by choosing different fonts, sizes, and styles for headers and labels, ensuring important data stands out or meets formatting requirements. Please note that the advanced settings for columns can vary depending on the datapack you are working with, allowing for tailored configurations that best fit the data characteristics.
settings.step4: In the Search Settings, you can quickly locate specific columns by entering keywords and then directly add them to your chart. Simply enter a term related to the setting you are looking for, and the system will display all relevant results.This feature is particularly useful when managing numerous data points or when you need to make quick adjustments without browsing through extensive lists.
settings.step5: The Font Settings section allows you to customize the appearance of text within your charts. You can adjust font styles, sizes, and formatting for various elements such as column headers, age labels, and more. Each setting is inheritable, ensuring consistency across related elements unless specified otherwise. Changing a font setting here applies it system-wide, but you can override these for individual columns by using the "Change Font" option within each columns settings.Experiment with different fonts and sizes to enhance readability and visual appeal of your charts.
settings.step6: In the Map Points Settings, you can access and manage geographic data points for different locations. This feature allows you to view specific location details directly on the interactive map. You can toggle different map layers and visualize data points with detailed descriptions, like latitude, longitude, and additional notes. Please note, however, that not all datapacks contain map points.
settings.step7: In the Datapacks Settings, you can select the datapacks you wish to use for generating charts. We offer nine official datapacks, each comprising a curated collection of datasets tailored for specific thematic explorations. You might notice that this page resembles the Datapack page; selections can be configured here or there interchangeably. For more detailed guidance on how to utilize datapacks, please refer to the Datapacks Tour in the Help page "Tours" section.
